commits.message:
Make upgrade quit running ``euca_conf --setup''

Whenever ``euca_conf --setup'' runs it recursively changes permissions
in a bunch of subdirectories of /var/lib/eucalyptus.  This breaks
things when the eucalyptus user must not own some of the files there,
such as when you're using certain storage systems that put snapshots
or metadata there.

In this episode of this recurring bug (number 3, if you're keeping
track), we remove a call to this function from euca_upgrade.  This is
the last call to this command that I can find in the source tree,
so hopefully it isn't going to show up again.  Hopefully.

If you aren't running an install where packaging will take care of
permissions for you, don't forget to run it if necessary.

Fixes EUCA-4277
